alert.note: Alert for Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Harlan County through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kentenia, or near Harlan, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Loyall and Liggett around 315 PM EDT. Harlan, Teetersville, Elcomb, Tway, Sunshine, Mary Alice, Harlan Gas and Baxter around 320 PM EDT. Chevrolet, Lenarve, Grays Knob, Clovertown, Kitts, Coxton, Golden Ash and Rosspoint around 325 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Bobs Creek, Ages, Three Point, Martins Fork Lake, Crummies, Verda, Kildav, Bailey Creek, Evarts, Kenvir, Cranks, Darkmont, Short Town, Black Mountain, Colts and Shields. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
